keyword: how many calories in one cup of flour
title: How Many Calories in One Cup of Flour?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in one cup of flour, plus carbs, protein, fat, full nutrition breakdown, and easy tweaks for baking.
h1: How Many Calories in One Cup of Flour?
assumptions: All-purpose white flour, unsifted, standard US cup measure (~125 g).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by flour type, brand, sifting method, and packing density. A cup can range 100-140 g; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of all-purpose flour provides ~455 kcal, mostly from 95 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Whole wheat flour instead of all-purpose

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of all-purpose flour?
faqs.a: About 455 kcal for one unsifted cup (~125 g).

faqs.q: What are the carbs in one cup of flour?
faqs.a: Approximately 95 g total carbs, with 3.4 g fiber and minimal sugars.

faqs.q: Does sifting flour change the calories?
faqs.a: Yes, sifted is less dense (~100 g), reducing calories to ~364 kcal per cup.

faqs.q: How much protein is in one cup of flour?
faqs.a: Around 12.4 g protein per cup of all-purpose flour.

faqs.q: Why do flour calories vary by measurement?
faqs.a: Packing or sifting affects weight per cup; spoon-and-level is lighter than scoop-and-pack.
